result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Laura Ann Walker in court.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defendant does not appear; Ms. Walker indicates she has left messages but has not been able to reach the defendant nor has she received any return calls/texts. The State asks for a new date as they have arrived at new number 

BTC: Adj granted  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Laura Ann Walker in court.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Restitution hearing cannot go forward.  Defendant told attorney he did not receive notice of today's date.  State also believes no notice was sent to victims.
Attempts to reach defendant by phone were unsuccessful.  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Laura Ann Walker appeared by speaker phone. Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Request the court make a good cause finding on the issue of restitution.
Def- No objection.
BTC: Good cause finding made.  Restitution hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Robert J Rutka

Prior: 938 S 74th St, West Allis, WI 53214

Defendant Robert J Rutka in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Robert J Rutka in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- In 11CF156 Plea to count 1. In 15CF1046 Plea to count 1 & count 2; DRI the balance. In 14CF1012 DRI.
Rights Given
P- Guilty
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1 in 11CF156; count 1 & count 2 in 15CF1046; DRI the balance; DRI 14CF1012. Order a PSI.
Def- In 11CF156 & 15CF1046 request the bond be modified to signature bond so the defendant can be granted Huber.
St- Objects to the bond modification.
BTC: Bond modification granted. In 11CF156 $2,500 signature bond & in 15CF1046 $300 signature bond. No contact with any of the victims and do not drive unless properly licensed.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert J Rutka in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Robert J Rutka in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Requesting the bond be modified.
St- Request another date for the bond hearing as there is victim notification.
BTC: Adj  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 09:00 am.
ATTY Walker files motion for reduction of bond.
Reading waived.
Pre-trial conference at 12-18-2015 08:15 am
NG plea entered.

Defendant Robert J Rutka in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Robert J Rutka in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Laura Walker

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Do not drive unless properly licensed. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Preliminary hearing at 11-04-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Robert J Rutka in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson. Defendant Robert J Rutka in custody. Patricia J Hanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
BTC: VACATE WARRANT. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
St- In 11CF156 bond has been forfeited. Request a $2,500 cash bond on each file.
Def- Request a small amount of cash
BTC: In 15CF1046 bond set at $300 cash, in 14CF1012 bond set at $500 cash and in 11CF156 $2,500 cash. No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  Do not drive unless properly licensed.
Defendant in custody; original warrant in file.
